alert.note: Alert for Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 3:58PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Cochise County through 445 PM MST... At 357 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Portal, or near Rodeo, moving northwest at 15 to 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Portal, Chiricahua National Monument and Paradise. This includes Route 181 between mile markers 50 and 52, and near mile marker 64. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox
